title: Instructional Design Strategies to Prevent Student Dropout in Flexible Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science theories and research methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners, comprising medical/legal/technical professionals, study in a limited-technology environment (primarily smartphones) on flexible schedules and must demonstrate competencies through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners achieve 80% or higher weekly learning plan implementation rate using the online Learning Management System (LMS)
Students submit three consecutive improvement reports based on formative assessment feedback
Learners derive three or more learning strategy improvements through peer and self-assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
